website_summaries.verdict: Easy to clean and fill, this well-padded backpack features a pressure gauge so you know when it's time to pump and a stainless steel wand.
pros: Comfortable: padded shoulder straps and cushion-grip shutoff
cons: The plastic threads on the screws can strip relatively easily

website_summaries.verdict: An excellent, easy-to-use unit that is easily the best on the market right now and is well worth the investment.
pros: Easy to assemble, use, and clean up
cons: On the more expensive side, but you are paying for quality and performance

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy with this sprayer. I have used it twice to spray weeds in my 1/4 acre yard. Each time I have used it, I have end up with chemicals all down my backside due to the pump leaking while pumping it. In addition to the leaking pump, the straps on it are very cheaply made. This is a poor product and I am very disappointed with this sprayer. I missed the return period through amazon and the manufacturer is not willing to return it. Poor product with bad customer service. I do not recommend buying Chapin products. I guess I just learned a lesson that cost me $71.99.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sprayer but hope you never need parts
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good sprayer, I actually purchased two of them. The issue I have is that two parts failed after 1.5 years and need to be replaced and the part cost is outrageous. The entire sprayer delieved to my door via Amazon Prime is $72. I need to replace my constant flow valve and pressure gauge, nothing more. The Chapin cost delieved to me is in excess of $55! I suspect that the cost of these parts is less than $5. I will not spend $55 for 2 small parts on a $70 sprayer. Instead I will throw it out and try a different brand that charges reasonable amounts for service components.
customer_reviews.author: Driver

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it was coming apart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sprayer 1 year ago, went to use it and pumped it up and around the Handel roundup came out everywhere. Looks like it was coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: Royce

customer_reviews.title: Plastic threaded parts are not made of good quality materials, they strip too easily.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic on the threads on this unit are made of plastic that is too soft, as the threads will strip out too easy with hardly any pressure when tightening. If this is truly a Turf PRO Commercial sprayer, you would think that it would be made with higher quality parts. Once you strip the threads you will have to spend $4.15 to replace thee nozzle kit (part 6-8148), and then pay $5.50 to have it shipped, which is totally ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lovitt

customer_reviews.title: chapin mistake
customer_reviews.text: I hate this sprayer it is the worst sprayer I have ever bought period. Ithe pumping system is a complete joke the way it fits is hideous and I couldn't wait to use my 1 gallon sprayer. I just used it for the first time. what a disappointment. I would like a refund on this.
customer_reviews.author: PSlikes2talk

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought years ago
customer_reviews.text: Broke down and purchased the unit after seeing on Amazon Deal of the Day sale. Glad I did, trucking the one gallon jug around for many years had gotten tiresome and limits the area to cover. Now living in Florida with a home and about 1/2 acre to cover, this unit works quite well. Like the extra filter to insure mixing is thorough before dispensing and preventing the nozzle from being clogged. As suggested for large area spraying, have switched to the constant spray nozzle and am pleased with the performance. Spray is even, thorough, and consistent. Using the pump handle is simple and the unit is well balanced on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: toast after very light use
customer_reviews.text: The pressure gauge fills up with water. It costs about the same to replace it as it would to buy a new one. Only used it a handful of times, wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap metal used in this product just sheared off after a day and half of use.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product intending to spray my fruit trees with dormant oil. It worked for a day and half, then the metal bar attached to the pumper handle sheared off at the site where the screw hole was drilled to hold it to the frame. I would not recommend this product to anyone. If the metal were of a higher quality and last more than a couple days of use, I would recommend it, but as is, definitely not. I did not realize I had one month to return it via Amazon, and now I am out the cost of the unit; sad face.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hair

customer_reviews.title: Great Sprayer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sprayer so I could apply an oil spray to kill 'gloomy scale' on one of my maple trees. It allowed me to spray product about 25 feet up the trunk with great accuracy. I have had other small hand held pump sprayers, but this has become my favorite. It comes with several different spray pattern tips, an easy to modulate spray trigger and a good sized four gallon tank. It is easy to fill and clean and seems very durable. I am a six foot tall male weighing 280 pounds, and the straps are just long enough to give me a good fit. Overall I am delighted with this sprayer!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Mack

customer_reviews.title: cant use anything but water.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last for 2 gallons. Pump had rotten rubber from sitting in warehouse to long. Amazon does not warrant this product. Why do they not state this unit can't be used with anything but water? Can't use vinegar. I want to return it but can't. Order detailsOrdered on July 11, 2020 (1 item)first use Sept/10/2020 Chapin 61900 4-Gallon Tree and Turf Pro Commercial Backpack Sprayer with Stainless Steel Wand Chapin International Sold by: Amazon.com Services LLC
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rippie

customer_reviews.title: Expect it to last 1 to 1.5 years before replacing
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer is well made but you should expect to replace parts every so often after the first year of use. To be fair, this unit sat in a shed and was subject the temperature changes in the northeastern US. But, parts are expensive. After 18 months the pressure gauge fills with chemicals and leaks ($30) o-rings begin to fail ($15) and nozzles need replacing ($15)... and many of these parts are backordered for weeks. I hate to generate waste but it almost makes sense to order a whole new unit and save bits from the old one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product that leaks
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked fine for a while. I used it once a week for the garden. After a year, it started springing leaks. Around the spray, around the hose, everywhere. I took off the handle and reattached it carefully, I tightened everything again and again AND AGAIN. It KEPT LEAKING. I spray my yard with seaweed and it's ANNOYING to get seaweed over your legs because of this thing. I have no IDEA how they can call this a professional tool, because it's a piece of garbage. In the endi smashed it. I'll order a replacement from Germany or somewhere that actually still gives a crap about quality.
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: You have to be good sized person to use this product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful and apparently well built unit. But at 5'6" and 140lbs, the harness simply does not adjust down to my size. It takes a quite a bit of muscle to use the pump handle and get decent pressure. The pump handle is too long for me and because the harness is too loose, standing, I never was able to get the pressure above 40lbs. Sitting on the stairs with the backpack pressed against the next higher step, I got the pressure to approach 60lbs. Without pumping, the pressure drops to naught within 5-7 seconds. Unfortunately, I've had the unit for longer than 30 days.........
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not well thought out
customer_reviews.text: This sprayer is ......ok.....I don't know why they wasted the money putting a gauge on it-I can't imagine anyone ever using it. That I'd really like is a handle on the tank so I can pick it up and move it around when it's full. Also, I spent a few extra bucks and got the stainless steel wand. There are what appear to be some kind of holder molded into the tank lid to hold the wand so It is protected from damage. The wand doesn't fit! Plus, they added a fence waist pad and yet all the weight is on your shoulder, not your waist. Now, I'm stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V

customer_reviews.title: Love it except....
customer_reviews.text: Love the sprayer. However, shut off assembly (part with trigger and gauge) is made out of plastic and has now burst two years in a row. I keep the sprayer in a backyard shed which is obviously NOT temperature controlled. Both winters resulted in that assembly bursting (swelled plastic and created pinhole.) I thought the first year this was caused by the cap on top of tank being screwed on (with low pressure in tank) creating nowhere for expansion to go. Second year I left the cap off...still burst assembly with just small amount of liquid in hose (tank was empty.) Very disappointed in this quality for this particular part.
customer_reviews.author: GaDAWG

customer_reviews.title: The New Chaplin does not live up to Expectations
customer_reviews.text: The new 61900 tree Ana’s Turf Pro has some nice bells and whistles that sold me on the unit. The pressure gauge on the wand is very helpful. The backpack assembly is well designed and the pump handle is well positioned. However, the only way to carry the unit, which is heavy and awkward, is with a back strap. The cover no longer incorporates a handle for easy carrying. I find I’m using my older model just for the ease of use. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: mcschroeder1

customer_reviews.title: Not my Cup of Tea
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had listen to others that gave reviews and said to buy one with a battery pack trying to keep this thing pumped up when you only use it a few times a year not easy. Leave this model to the professionals that use it everyday as pumping and spraying I know would get easier if you did all the time but I don't so Battery power is the way to go on a 4 gallon sprayer in my opinion. But it does work good but hard to use and tiring if you are not used to it I spray about 1/3 - 1/2 acre when using it just a fyi.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ignat

customer_reviews.title: Overall review.
customer_reviews.text: 61900: Very nice product. My first job was to spray 19,000 sq. ft. for chinch bugs. After a couple hours, and 5 refills, I was not exhausted. It worked well. The shoulder straps are not well padded as advertised. They are well built, but stiff with not much cushion. I fixed that by taping a couple old folded up washcloths on, which worked just fine then. I would pay $5 or more more to have nice cushioned straps. The CF valve keeps even pressure, but it needs almost continuous pumping to keep the pressure up, which isn't hard to do. Of the best five similar products by an independent review, I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: murray george

customer_reviews.title: good product, but is extremely difficult to put on
customer_reviews.text: product as a sprayer is excellent. The harness is a nightmare to use it will generally require two people to in order to put it on (loaded) as the buckles and harness are very counter intuitive, and will require lots of patience and help to finally have the backpack on (loaded with spray liquid). everything else is great nozzles, adjustability of the nozzles and option all 5 stars. ability to put it on 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: PsychoDrifter

customer_reviews.title: Great lawn tool
customer_reviews.text: I am always fighting off weeds and this thing is a great help. It is much better than buying the spray bottles in the store. This allows me to stand upright while spraying. There is an easy to use pump to maintain pressure while spraying; and a pressure gauge on the wand. Wand spray a good mist. This has cut down on the time I spend on lawn care and prevents me from bending over all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Finally got my back pack sprayer assembled and ready to use. Not bad to assemble and loved that it came with multiple tips to use. Easy to pump and great regulated sprayer. Honestly I’d upgrade to a battery operated sprayer but if that’s not what your looking for then this product is worth the money. Would love to see better more comfy straps but they aren’t bad.
customer_reviews.author: Sam DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: great sprayer
customer_reviews.text: At first I did not like the waist strap and was irritated that there was not an option to remove. I used the sprayer for the first time of any extended time this past weekend. Now I love the waist strap and understand the thought process behind having it. sprayer is great.
customer_reviews.author: Lann Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Makes spraying easier
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of poison ivy and other undesirable vegetation. It's among trees, so no way to get a tractor or similar device in. This works great. It's easy to pump while spraying, and the 4 gallon capacity lasts a good while. I found it easiest to put on by filling it on the tailgate of my pickup, then backing into it and hooking up the straps before lifting the weight.
customer_reviews.author: z_Fisherww

customer_reviews.title: Finally a sprayer that isn't just JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I use product more efficiently and get more coverage of ground clear to kill any growth on landscape rocks here in Arizona. It's very comfortable and worth the money, I had a backpack style sprayer from home depot that the plastic cracked and reservoir was useless. This one has better parts all around, So I think it will be lasting a bit longer. I'll update if anything should change
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome Design Flaws - But Works
customer_reviews.text: I trust the Chapin name when it comes to sprayers. I've owned several. But this one was a disappointment. Most Chapin sprayers have handle grips in the lids for easy lifting and transport. This one does not. The pump lever does not rest in a 90 degree angle at anytime as shown in the picture so it's always protruding out and getting in the way. However, it does do what it's intended to do and I've had no issues so far except for these design flaws.
customer_reviews.author: DONNA MARIE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: As a small farmer, I have gone through many hand-held sprayers over the last decade, and have been dissappointed with the lot of them. The nozzles plugged easily, the wand pressure varied too much, they were a pain to lug around, and they wore out quickly. I hated spraying weeds. But his has revolutionized my weed spraying experience! I especially love not having the nozzle plug. EVER. And i love the consistent pressure at the wand from the pressure regulator. The backpack is sturdy, comfortable, holds a solid 4 gallons, and my farm looks better than ever. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built but very uncomfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I find that when this is full the shoulder straps dig into my shoulders so much that I end up with small blood blisters. I've had other brand bag pack sprayers that didn't do this. It's solidly built and have been using it for over a year twice a month so no complaints there.
customer_reviews.author: swlatiger

customer_reviews.title: Best Quality - At Better Price
customer_reviews.text: Solid product and built well. Great on spraying patio paver sealant - and other yard chemicals. Free pressure valve adapter that helps maintain an even nozzle end pressure - for steady, even flow. Other adapters included. Pump handle can be setup for right or left side connection. Great product would highly recommend + definitely buy again .
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Better than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Love this sprayer. Higher quality than I expected. Assembly instructions more than adequate. Included latest technology to allow steady application. Worked great in my pasture and reached the top of my trees with no problem. The various nozzles included are all of the highest quality brass.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Simple to get ready to use and a dream to use! The only thing I could recommend is starting out with 2gals to start with cause it's a work out on the shoulders lol It really is a great sprayer, I pity the weeds in my yard! lol Thanks Chapin for a super product!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: It's very fragile
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the sprayer for two months and although it works great, it is very fragile. First the nozzle broke and I was able to replace it for about $11. Now the gauge broke and although I don't think it really needs a gauge I will either have to replace it or plug it, I'll likely choose the latter. Two parts requiring replacement in as many months, two stars seems warranted.
customer_reviews.author: Garcia Family

customer_reviews.title: Stihl could learn from these people
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect Sprayer, I have an over priced Stihl that sucks! The Chapin is the best sprayer I have ever had. Very fast shipping, excellent quality. If you have a lot of material to put down, here's your Sprayer. Good luck and Happy Spraying!
customer_reviews.author: Divinewind55

We also offer full technical support via our Customer Service Team at 800-950-4458 and product information at chapinmfg.com
